Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION:
Ennis Center for Children - Detroit did not notify the court of Youth A and B’s foster
care worker changes and Youth A’s placement change.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A and B are siblings who had multiple foster care worker changes from
03/12/2019 to 12/08/2020. Each time Ennis Center for Children - Detroit failed to
notify Lenawee County Probate Court Family Division and complete an Action
Summary form (DHHS 69). Youth A was replaced in 09/2020 and Lenawee County
Probate Court Family Division was not notified and an Action Summary form (DHHS
69) was not completed.
2

I interviewed Ennis Center for Children – Detroit program director on 12/14/2020.
Program director stated Action Summary forms (DHHS 69) were completed
retroactively for each of Youth A and B’s foster care worker changes and for Youth
A’s replacement. The Action Summary forms were filed with Lenawee County
Probate Court Family Division on 12/11/2020. Program director stated there is a staff
training on 12/14/2020 to review the expectations and use of Action Summary forms
(DHHS 69).
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the child's
record before a change of placement occurs:
(f) Notification to the parents, referral source, lawyer
guardian ad litem, and courts when applicable, of the change in
placement.
ANALYSIS: The program director acknowledges that Action Summary forms
(DHHS 69) were not completed timely for Youth A and B’s foster
care worker changes and for Youth A’s replacement.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Ennis Center for Children - Detroit failed to obtain a court-ordered trauma
assessment for Youth A.
INVESTIGATION:
Lenawee County Probate Court Family Division ordered a trauma screening for
Youth A on 06/25/2020. This trauma screening was not completed by the
09/10/2020 and 12/08/2020 court hearings.
I interviewed Ennis Center for Children – Detroit program director on 12/14/2020.
Program director stated Youth A’s assigned Foster care worker in 06/2020 was a
new worker and did not complete the final steps for the trauma screening referral.
Program director stated the Foster care supervisor did not review Youth A’s case in
monthly supervision with the assigned Foster care worker and the Foster care
supervisor also did not review the case orders to ensure completion as required by
their policy and procedure. Program director stated this lapse was addressed with
the Foster care supervisor on 12/11/2020. Program director stated Youth A’s trauma
screening referral was completed and the information was filed with Lenawee
County Probate Court Family Division on 12/10/2020.
3

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12202 Policy and procedures.
(1) An agency shall have and follow written policies and
procedures for all of the following:
(e) Staff responsibilities.
ANALYSIS: Program director acknowledged that Ennis Center for Children –
Detroit did not complete a timely trauma referral for Youth A due
to a new Foster care worker being assigned to the case and the
Foster care supervisor did not review the case in monthly
supervision or review the orders of the case as required.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Complete a random review of foster care cases under this
Foster care supervisor to ensure adequate services are
provided and court orders are followed timely.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Ennis Center for Children - Detroit failed to file a petition to terminate parental rights
for Youth A and B.
INVESTIGATION:
Lenawee County Probate Court Family Division ordered Ennis Center for Children –
Detroit to start the termination of parental rights for Youth A and B on 04/14/2020.
The termination of parental rights petition was not filed at the 06/25/2020,
09/10/2020 and 12/08/2020 court hearing.
I interviewed Ennis Center for Children – Detroit program director on 12/14/2020.
Program director stated the petition to terminate parental rights for Youth A and B
was completed and filed with Lenawee County Probate Court Family Division on
12/09/2020.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12202 Policy and procedures.
(1) An agency shall have and follow written policies and
procedures for all of the following:
(e) Staff responsibilities.
4

ANALYSIS: Program director acknowledged that termination of parental
rights petition for Youth A and B was not completed timely.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
The continuance of a regular license is recommended upon receipt of an approved
corrective action plan.
